description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b3fng","text":"This protocol documents the production of cellular reagents. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0cu3","text":"Cellular reagents are defined as common molecular biology enzymes expressed in E.coli but not subsequently purified before use i.e. dried E.coli cells are used as the reagent (Bhadra et al (2018)).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfbif","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rb8a","text":"This protocol provides instructions for IPTG (T7 based) expression.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"9l8i","text":"This protocol describes the use of IPTG in inducing protein expression in E.coli BL 21 DE3 strain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Production of cellular reagents using IPTG,Protein expression in E.coli using IPTG,IPTG induction of protein expression in E.coli

containing 2x108 cells = 200/6.5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bb2fj","text":"volume containing 2x108 cells = 31µL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4kpp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"56ond","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgi0g","text":"Aliquot either single reaction or 10X reactions worth of cellular reagents into 8-tube strips of 0.2 mL PCR tubes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mv0n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2scbp","text":"e.g. using the example above, 3.1 µL (1x reaction) or 31 µL (10x).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":66}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddn2o","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e061n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7uiq6","text":"You can either aliquot ~2 x 107 cells (enough for a single PCR reaction) or 2 x 108 cells (enough for 10 PCR reactions) into individual 0.2 mL PCR tubes in order to prepare dried Taq cellular reagents. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

gently tapping onto the bottom of the tube and allow to stand for  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6ip0q","text":"Use a micropipette to aliquot  inoculate on an LB {"blocks":[{"key":"5mdtp","text":"Proceed to carry out quality control of this batch of cellular reagents by testing the functionality and assessing the them for endonuclease activity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":87,"length":13},{"key":1,"offset":128,"length":21}],"data":{}},{"key":"2cft6","text":"After passing the quality control test, the cellular reagents can be used in a PCR amplification reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AF9B1E7011A811EDA685E1294C9E1AE9","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/functionality-test-openvent-polymerase-pcr-master-x54v9y5r4g3e/v3"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9E1297F011A811EDA685E1294C9E1AE9","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/nuclease-test-openvent-polymerase-pcr-master-mix-d-j8nlkk1xwl5r/v2"}}}}
